00016 def scan(stream, Loader=Loader):
00017     """
00018     Scan a YAML stream and produce scanning tokens.
00019     """
00020     loader = Loader(stream)
00021     while loader.check_token():
00022         yield loader.get_token()
00023 
00024 def parse(stream, Loader=Loader):
00025     """
00026     Parse a YAML stream and produce parsing events.
00027     """
00028     loader = Loader(stream)
00029     while loader.check_event():
00030         yield loader.get_event()
00031 
00032 def compose(stream, Loader=Loader):
00033     """
00034     Parse the first YAML document in a stream
00035     and produce the corresponding representation tree.
00036     """
00037     loader = Loader(stream)
00038     if loader.check_node():
00039         return loader.get_node()
00040 
00041 def compose_all(stream, Loader=Loader):
00042     """
00043     Parse all YAML documents in a stream
00044     and produce corresponsing representation trees.
00045     """
00046     loader = Loader(stream)
00047     while loader.check_node():
00048         yield loader.get_node()
00049 
00050 def load_all(stream, Loader=Loader):
00051     """
00052     Parse all YAML documents in a stream
00053     and produce corresponding Python objects.
00054     """
00055     loader = Loader(stream)
00056     while loader.check_data():
00057         yield loader.get_data()
00058 
00059 def load(stream, Loader=Loader):
00060     """
00061     Parse the first YAML document in a stream
00062     and produce the corresponding Python object.
00063     """
00064     loader = Loader(stream)
00065     if loader.check_data():
00066         return loader.get_data()

00068 def safe_load_all(stream):
00069     """
00070     Parse all YAML documents in a stream
00071     and produce corresponding Python objects.
00072     Resolve only basic YAML tags.
00073     """
00074     return load_all(stream, SafeLoader)
00075 
00076 def safe_load(stream):
00077     """
00078     Parse the first YAML document in a stream
00079     and produce the corresponding Python object.
00080     Resolve only basic YAML tags.
00081     """
00082     return load(stream, SafeLoader)

00084 def emit(events, stream=None, Dumper=Dumper,
00085         canonical=None, indent=None, width=None,
00086         allow_unicode=None, line_break=None):
00087     """
00088     Emit YAML parsing events into a stream.
00089     If stream is None, return the produced string instead.
00090     """
00091     getvalue = None
00092     if stream is None:
00093         try:
00094             from cStringIO import StringIO
00095         except ImportError:
00096             from StringIO import StringIO
00097         stream = StringIO()
00098         getvalue = stream.getvalue
00099     dumper = Dumper(stream, canonical=canonical, indent=indent, width=width,
00100             allow_unicode=allow_unicode, line_break=line_break)
00101     for event in events:
00102         dumper.emit(event)
00103     if getvalue:
00104         return getvalue()
00105 
00106 def serialize_all(nodes, stream=None, Dumper=Dumper,
00107         canonical=None, indent=None, width=None,
00108         allow_unicode=None, line_break=None,
00109         encoding='utf-8', explicit_start=None, explicit_end=None,
00110         version=None, tags=None):
00111     """
00112     Serialize a sequence of representation trees into a YAML stream.
00113     If stream is None, return the produced string instead.
00114     """
00115     getvalue = None
00116     if stream is None:
00117         try:
00118             from cStringIO import StringIO
00119         except ImportError:
00120             from StringIO import StringIO
00121         stream = StringIO()
00122         getvalue = stream.getvalue
00123     dumper = Dumper(stream, canonical=canonical, indent=indent, width=width,
00124             allow_unicode=allow_unicode, line_break=line_break,
00125             encoding=encoding, version=version, tags=tags,
00126             explicit_start=explicit_start, explicit_end=explicit_end)
00127     dumper.open()
00128     for node in nodes:
00129         dumper.serialize(node)
00130     dumper.close()
00131     if getvalue:
00132         return getvalue()
00133 
00134 def serialize(node, stream=None, Dumper=Dumper, **kwds):
00135     """
00136     Serialize a representation tree into a YAML stream.
00137     If stream is None, return the produced string instead.
00138     """
00139     return serialize_all([node], stream, Dumper=Dumper, **kwds)

00141 def dump_all(documents, stream=None, Dumper=Dumper,
00142         default_style=None, default_flow_style=None,
00143         canonical=None, indent=None, width=None,
00144         allow_unicode=None, line_break=None,
00145         encoding='utf-8', explicit_start=None, explicit_end=None,
00146         version=None, tags=None):
00147     """
00148     Serialize a sequence of Python objects into a YAML stream.
00149     If stream is None, return the produced string instead.
00150     """
00151     getvalue = None
00152     if stream is None:
00153         try:
00154             from cStringIO import StringIO
00155         except ImportError:
00156             from StringIO import StringIO
00157         stream = StringIO()
00158         getvalue = stream.getvalue
00159     dumper = Dumper(stream, default_style=default_style,
00160             default_flow_style=default_flow_style,
00161             canonical=canonical, indent=indent, width=width,
00162             allow_unicode=allow_unicode, line_break=line_break,
00163             encoding=encoding, version=version, tags=tags,
00164             explicit_start=explicit_start, explicit_end=explicit_end)
00165     dumper.open()
00166     for data in documents:
00167         dumper.represent(data)
00168     dumper.close()
00169     if getvalue:
00170         return getvalue()
00171 
00172 def dump(data, stream=None, Dumper=Dumper, **kwds):
00173     """
00174     Serialize a Python object into a YAML stream.
00175     If stream is None, return the produced string instead.
00176     """
00177     return dump_all([data], stream, Dumper=Dumper, **kwds)

00179 def safe_dump_all(documents, stream=None, **kwds):
00180     """
00181     Serialize a sequence of Python objects into a YAML stream.
00182     Produce only basic YAML tags.
00183     If stream is None, return the produced string instead.
00184     """
00185     return dump_all(documents, stream, Dumper=SafeDumper, **kwds)

00190     Produce only basic YAML tags.
00191     If stream is None, return the produced string instead.
00192     """
00193     return dump_all([data], stream, Dumper=SafeDumper, **kwds)

00195 def add_implicit_resolver(tag, regexp, first=None,
00196         Loader=Loader, Dumper=Dumper):
00197     """
00198     Add an implicit scalar detector.
00199     If an implicit scalar value matches the given regexp,
00200     the corresponding tag is assigned to the scalar.
00201     first is a sequence of possible initial characters or None.
00202     """
00203     Loader.add_implicit_resolver(tag, regexp, first)
00204     Dumper.add_implicit_resolver(tag, regexp, first)
00205 
00206 def add_path_resolver(tag, path, kind=None, Loader=Loader, Dumper=Dumper):
00207     """
00208     Add a path based resolver for the given tag.
00209     A path is a list of keys that forms a path
00210     to a node in the representation tree.
00211     Keys can be string values, integers, or None.
00212     """
00213     Loader.add_path_resolver(tag, path, kind)
00214     Dumper.add_path_resolver(tag, path, kind)
00215 
00216 def add_constructor(tag, constructor, Loader=Loader):
00217     """
00218     Add a constructor for the given tag.
00219     Constructor is a function that accepts a Loader instance
00220     and a node object and produces the corresponding Python object.
00221     """
00222     Loader.add_constructor(tag, constructor)
00223 
00224 def add_multi_constructor(tag_prefix, multi_constructor, Loader=Loader):
00225     """
00226     Add a multi-constructor for the given tag prefix.
00227     Multi-constructor is called for a node if its tag starts with tag_prefix.
00228     Multi-constructor accepts a Loader instance, a tag suffix,
00229     and a node object and produces the corresponding Python object.
00230     """
00231     Loader.add_multi_constructor(tag_prefix, multi_constructor)
00232 
00233 def add_representer(data_type, representer, Dumper=Dumper):
00234     """
00235     Add a representer for the given type.
00236     Representer is a function accepting a Dumper instance
00237     and an instance of the given data type
00238     and producing the corresponding representation node.
00239     """
00240     Dumper.add_representer(data_type, representer)
00241 
00242 def add_multi_representer(data_type, multi_representer, Dumper=Dumper):
00243     """
00244     Add a representer for the given type.
00245     Multi-representer is a function accepting a Dumper instance
00246     and an instance of the given data type or subtype
00247     and producing the corresponding representation node.
00248     """
00249     Dumper.add_multi_representer(data_type, multi_representer)

00251 class YAMLObjectMetaclass(type):
00252     """
00253     The metaclass for YAMLObject.
00254     """
00255     def __init__(cls, name, bases, kwds):
00256         super(YAMLObjectMetaclass, cls).__init__(name, bases, kwds)
00257         if 'yaml_tag' in kwds and kwds['yaml_tag'] is not None:
00258             cls.yaml_loader.add_constructor(cls.yaml_tag, cls.from_yaml)
00259             cls.yaml_dumper.add_representer(cls, cls.to_yaml)
00260 
00261 class YAMLObject(object):
00262     """
00263     An object that can dump itself to a YAML stream
00264     and load itself from a YAML stream.
00265     """
00266 
00267     __metaclass__ = YAMLObjectMetaclass
00268     __slots__ = ()  # no direct instantiation, so allow immutable subclasses
00269 
00270     yaml_loader = Loader
00271     yaml_dumper = Dumper
00272 
00273     yaml_tag = None
00274     yaml_flow_style = None
00275 
00276     def from_yaml(cls, loader, node):
00277         """
00278         Convert a representation node to a Python object.
00279         """
00280         return loader.construct_yaml_object(node, cls)
00281     from_yaml = classmethod(from_yaml)
00282 
00283     def to_yaml(cls, dumper, data):
00284         """
00285         Convert a Python object to a representation node.
00286         """
00287         return dumper.represent_yaml_object(cls.yaml_tag, data, cls,
00288                 flow_style=cls.yaml_flow_style)
00289     to_yaml = classmethod(to_yaml)
